GL_UNIFIED_CHARTER.description: MNGA Governance Layer Unified Charter - 100 Semantic Anchors

GL00-GL09.description: Fundamental language specifications for syntax, parsing, and tokenization

GL00.name: YAML Language Specification
GL00.definition: Formal specification of YAML syntax including indentation rules, key-value pairs, anchors, aliases, and data types
GL00.scope: All YAML files in the repository including configurations, manifests, and governance contracts
GL00.semantic_boundaries: Strict YAML 1.2 compliance with custom anchor/alias extensions

GL01.name: JSON Language Specification
GL01.definition: Formal specification of JSON syntax including key-value pairs, arrays, objects, and data type constraints
GL01.scope: All JSON files including schemas, metadata, and evidence artifacts
GL01.semantic_boundaries: RFC 8259 compliance with additional schema validation

GL02.name: Markdown Language Specification
GL02.definition: Formal specification of Markdown syntax including headings, lists, code blocks, and inline formatting
GL02.scope: All documentation files including README, guides, and technical specifications
GL02.semantic_boundaries: CommonMark specification with GitHub Flavored Markdown extensions

GL03.name: Python Language Specification
GL03.definition: Formal specification of Python syntax including indentation, modules, classes, and type hints
GL03.scope: All Python source files in the ecosystem
GL03.semantic_boundaries: Python 3.11+ compliance with PEP 8 style guidelines

GL04.name: Shell Script Specification
GL04.definition: Formal specification of bash/shell script syntax including variables, functions, and control structures
GL04.scope: All shell scripts for automation and deployment
GL04.semantic_boundaries: POSIX shell compliance with bash extensions

GL05.name: TypeScript Specification
GL05.definition: Formal specification of TypeScript syntax including types, interfaces, and generics
GL05.scope: All TypeScript source files for web interfaces and tooling
GL05.semantic_boundaries: TypeScript 5.0+ compliance with strict type checking

GL06.name: DSL-Core Specification
GL06.definition: Formal specification of the MNGA Governance DSL syntax and semantics
GL06.scope: All governance rule definitions and policy specifications
GL06.semantic_boundaries: Custom DSL with YAML-based syntax and semantic validation

GL07.name: Regex Specification
GL07.definition: Formal specification of regular expression syntax and patterns
GL07.scope: All regex patterns used in validation and parsing
GL07.semantic_boundaries: Python re module compliance with Unicode support

GL08.name: GraphQL Specification
GL08.definition: Formal specification of GraphQL query language syntax and schema definitions
GL08.scope: All GraphQL schemas and queries for API interfaces

GL09.name: SQL Specification
GL09.definition: Formal specification of SQL query language syntax and data manipulation
GL09.scope: All SQL queries for data retrieval and manipulation

GL10-GL19.description: Abstract syntax tree, tokenization, and grammatical structures

GL10.name: AST Model Specification
GL10.definition: Formal definition of Abstract Syntax Tree structures for all supported languages
GL10.scope: All parser implementations and AST transformations
GL10.semantic_boundaries: Language-agnostic AST model with language-specific extensions

GL11.name: Token Model Specification
GL11.definition: Formal specification of token types, tokenization rules, and token streams
GL11.scope: All lexer implementations and token processing pipelines
GL11.semantic_boundaries: Unified token model with language-specific token definitions

GL12.name: Grammar Rules Specification
GL12.definition: Formal grammar definitions for all supported languages using BNF/EBNF notation
GL12.scope: All language grammars and parser generators
GL12.semantic_boundaries: Context-free grammars with semantic action specifications

GL13.name: Lexical Rules Specification
GL13.definition: Formal specification of lexical analysis rules including character classes and patterns
GL13.scope: All lexer implementations and lexical analyzers
GL13.semantic_boundaries: Regular expression-based lexical rules with Unicode support

GL14.name: Semantic Rules Specification
GL14.definition: Formal specification of language semantics including type systems and evaluation rules
GL14.scope: All semantic analyzers and type checkers
GL14.semantic_boundaries: Static and dynamic semantic rules with formal verification

GL15.name: Language Versioning Specification
GL15.definition: Formal specification of language version management and compatibility rules
GL15.scope: All language version declarations and migration strategies
GL15.semantic_boundaries: Semantic versioning with backward compatibility guarantees

GL16.name: Language Constraints Specification
GL16.definition: Formal specification of language restrictions and prohibited constructs
GL16.scope: All language constraint definitions and enforcement mechanisms
GL16.semantic_boundaries: Whitelist-based allowed constructs with explicit prohibitions

GL17.name: Language Extensions Specification
GL17.definition: Formal specification of language extensions and custom syntax
GL17.scope: All language extension definitions and implementations
GL17.semantic_boundaries: Well-defined extension points with backward compatibility

GL18.name: Language Safety Specification
GL18.definition: Formal specification of language safety properties and guarantees
GL18.scope: All language safety mechanisms and runtime protections
GL18.semantic_boundaries: Memory safety, type safety, and execution safety guarantees

GL19.name: Language Compatibility Specification
GL19.definition: Formal specification of cross-language compatibility and interoperability
GL19.scope: All language boundary definitions and interoperability layers
GL19.semantic_boundaries: Well-defined foreign function interfaces and data marshaling
